description: This operation allows you to perform transactional reads or writes on data stored in DynamoDB, using PartiQL.

parameters.name: TransactStatements
parameters.description: The list of PartiQL statements representing the transaction to run. (dict) --- Represents a PartiQL statement that uses parameters. A PartiQL statement that uses parameters. Parameters (list) --- The parameter values. (dict) --- Represents the data for an attribute. Each attribute value is described as a name-value pair. The name is the data type, and the value is the data itself. For more information, see Data Types in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide. S (string) --- An attribute of type String. For example: "S": "Hello" N (string) --- An attribute of type Number. For example: "N": "123.45" Numbers are sent across the network to DynamoDB as strings, to maximize compatibility across languages and libraries. However, DynamoDB treats them as number type attributes for mathematical operations. B (bytes) --- An attribute of type Binary. For example: "B": "dGhpcyB0ZXh0IGlzIGJhc2U2NC1lbmNvZGVk" SS (list) --- An attribute of type String Set. For example: "SS": ["Giraffe", "Hippo" ,"Zebra"] (string) --- NS (list) --- An attribute of type Number Set. For example: "NS": ["42.2", "-19", "7.5", "3.14"] Numbers are sent across the network to DynamoDB as strings, to maximize compatibility across languages and libraries. (string) --- BS (list) --- An attribute of type Binary Set. For example: "BS": ["U3Vubnk=", "UmFpbnk=", "U25vd3k="] (bytes) --- M (dict) --- An attribute of type Map. For example: "M": {"Name": {"S": "Joe"}, "Age": {"N": "35"}} (string) --- (dict) --- Represents the data for an attribute. L (list) --- An attribute of type List. For example: "L": [ {"S": "Cookies"} , {"S": "Coffee"}, {"N": "3.14159"}] (dict) --- Represents the data for an attribute. NULL (boolean) --- An attribute of type Null. For example: "NULL": true BOOL (boolean) --- An attribute of type Boolean. For example: "BOOL": true ReturnValuesOnConditionCheckFailure (string) --- An optional parameter that returns the item attributes for a PartiQL ParameterizedStatement operation that failed a condition check. There is no additional cost associated with requesting a return value aside from the small network and processing overhead of receiving a larger response. No read capacity units are consumed.

nested_params.name: Statement
nested_params.description: A PartiQL statement that uses parameters.

nested_params.description: An attribute of type String. For example: "S": "Hello"

nested_params.description: An attribute of type Number. For example: "N": "123.45" Numbers are sent across the network to DynamoDB as strings, to maximize compatibility across languages and libraries. However, DynamoDB treats them as number type attributes for mathematical operations.

nested_params.name: B
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Binary. For example: "B": "dGhpcyB0ZXh0IGlzIGJhc2U2NC1lbmNvZGVk"

For example: "NS": ["42.2", "-19", "7.5", "3.14"] Numbers are sent across the network to DynamoDB as strings, to maximize compatibility across languages and libraries. However, DynamoDB treats them as number type attributes for mathematical operations.

nested_params.name: BS
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Binary Set. For example: "BS": ["U3Vubnk=", "UmFpbnk=", "U25vd3k="]

nested_params.name: M
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Map. For example: "M": {"Name": {"S": "Joe"}, "Age": {"N": "35"}}

nested_params.name: L
nested_params.description: An attribute of type List. For example: "L": [ {"S": "Cookies"} , {"S": "Coffee"}, {"N": "3.14159"}]

nested_params.name: NULL
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Null. For example: "NULL": true.

nested_params.name: BOOL
nested_params.description: An attribute of type Boolean. For example: "BOOL": true.

nested_params.name: ReturnValuesOnConditionCheckFailure
nested_params.description: An optional parameter that returns the item attributes for a PartiQL ParameterizedStatement operation that failed a condition check. There is no additional cost associated with requesting a return value aside from the small network and processing overhead of receiving a larger response. No read capacity units are consumed.

parameters.name: ClientRequestToken
parameters.description: Set this value to get remaining results, if NextToken was returned in the statement response. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: Responses
nested_items.description: The response to a PartiQL transaction.

nested_items.name: ConsumedCapacity
nested_items.description: The capacity units consumed by the entire operation. The values of the list are ordered according to the ordering of the statements.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table that was affected by the operation. If you had specified the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a table in the input, you'll see the table ARN in the response.

nested_items.name: CapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of capacity units consumed by the operation.

nested_items.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of read capacity units consumed by the operation.

nested_items.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of write capacity units consumed by the operation.

nested_items.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The total number of read capacity units consumed on a table or an index.

nested_items.description: The total number of write capacity units consumed on a table or an index.

nested_items.description: The total number of capacity units consumed on a table or an index.

nested_items.name: LocalSecondaryIndexes
nested_items.description: The amount of throughput consumed on each local index affected by the operation.
